definition.name: NXchemical_composition

symbols.doc: The symbols used in the schema to specify e.g. dimensions of arrays.

symbol.name: n
symbol.doc: The number of samples or things.

definition.doc: (Chemical) composition of a sample or a set of things.

field.name: normalization
field.doc: Reporting compositions as atom and weight percent yields both dimensionless quantities but their conceptual interpretation differs. A normalization based on atom_percent counts relative to the total number of atoms which are of a particular type. By contrast, weight_percent normalization factorizes in the respective mass of the elements. Python libraries like pint are challenged by these differences as at.-% and wt.-% are both fractional quantities.

field.name: total
field.doc: Total based on which composition information is normalized.

group.name: ELEMENT
group.doc: Instances should use element as a name prefix and start counting at 1 such that the name of each group already informs humans for which element a composition is provided.

field.name: chemical_symbol
field.doc: Human-readable name of the element (e.g. Fe). Name has to be a symbol of an element from the periodic table. All symbols in the set of NXion instances inside the group chemical_composition need to be disjoint.

field.name: composition
field.doc: Composition value for the element/ion referred to under name. The value is normalized based on normalization, i.e. composition is either an atom or weight percent quantity.

field.name: composition_error
field.doc: Magnitude of the standard deviation of the composition.

field.name: count
field.doc: Count or weight which, when divided by total yields the composition of this element, isotope, molecule or ion.

field.name: composition
field.doc: Count divided by total in atom percent.

field.name: composition_error
field.doc: Magnitude of the standard deviation of the composition.
